Introduction
SDMMC_LowLevel_RTOS_SDMMC004 App

Introduction

SDMMC stands for Secure Digital and Multimedia Card. SD/MMC Memory Card is specifically designed to meet the security, capacity,performance, and environment requirements inherent in newly emerging audio and video consumer electronic devices. SDMMC004 App is the low-level driver for SDMMC cards. SD/MMC cards can be used as a data storage for error logging purposes. This App is designed to drive SDMMC card with functionalities like writing or reading single/multiple blocks of data from the card and with all the security features. It provides interface-functions to access the hardware. Depending on the used controller a SD-Card can be accessed in SD-Mode or SPI-Mode. This driver supports only SD mode. Faster data transmission is also supported depending on the card's support for 1-bit or 4-bit data lines. User has the liberty to configure for faster transmission through GUI. High Speed transmission is supported for up to 50MHz SD clock.The driver implements for both the card detection and non-card detection circuit. In case of non-card detection circuit, if the user removes the card while some transaction is in process, then card must be inserted in next power cycle. In case of card detection circuit, the upper layer needs to register a call back function to driver which will be called from the low-level driver if any card insertion or removal event occurs. The driver uses the RTOS001 App for detecting timeouts. Function's re-entrancy is maintained using mutex and semaphores. The driver implements the SD Host Controller Simplified Specification (Reference 1) .

Scope

SDMMC_LowLevel_RTOS_SDMMC004 App performs all the SD and MMC card related functionalities in RTOS environment. It is an interface to access/drive the hardware as shown in the figure below:

SDMMC004_abbreviation

  1. SDMMC : Secure Digital/ Multimedia Card
  2. API : Application Program Interface
  3. GUI : Graphical User Interface
  4. IOCTL : Input/Output Control
  5. DMA : Direct Memory Access
  6. RTOS : Real Time Operating System
  7. LLD : Low Level Driver
  8. CSD : Card Specific Data
  9. CID : Card identification number
  10. OCR : Operation conditions register
  11. SCR : SD Configuration Register
  12. CSR : Card Status Register
  13. RCA : Relative card address
  14. AU: Allocation Unit

SDMMC004_reference

  1. https://www.sdcard.org/downloads/pls/simplified_specs/Part_A2_SD_Host_Controller_Simplified_Specification_Ver3.00_Final_110225.pdf
  2. https://www.sdcard.org/downloads/pls/simplified_specs/Part_1_Physical_Layer_Simplified_Specification_Ver_3.01_Final_100518.pdf"

SDMMC004_limitation

None
